txt.en: A dead horse lies at this spire; you should examine it
This place is clutched in the grips of a particularly violent lingering winter
You feel colder than you have ever felt before as you approach the strange landmark
The winter weather here is especially cruel, and ice-shards pierce the earth like shining knives
The winter weather here is especially cruel, and ice-shards pierce the earth like shining knives

'I see signs of NÃºrzum! He was here... I know it. Do you see the great spires of ice to the north and south?

'Perhaps this mysterious artifact we seek can be found at one of those icy protrusions on the horizon.

'Will you scout them while I ride to Dunfast? I worry for the people of that town.'
Strange spires pierce the flat lands to the north and south of the road, landmarks that Cyneberg declares are entirely new to the plains of the Whitshaws.
Search the strange spire to the south-west of the cross-roads
Cyneberg has ridden ahead to Dunfast, which lies westward along the Whitshaws road from Forlaw.\n\nYou should meet up with Cyneberg at Dunfast.

'What is out there? I have never seen anything like it before. The Whitshaws has always been a flat land, save for a few trees to the north-west.

'Perhaps this mysterious artifact we seek can be found at one of those strange spires on the horizon.

'Will you scout them while I ride to Dunfast? I worry for the people of that town.'

The strange spires on the landscape can be found north, south, and south-west of the cross-roads in the south-eastern Whitshaws.\n\nYou should scout the three spires that can be seen from the cross-roads.
'Did you find anything noteworthy? Tell me everything -- but I have news for you as well.\n\n'Dunfast is empty!'

The strange spires on the landscape can be found north, south, and south-west of the cross-roads in the south-eastern Whitshaws.\n\nYou should scout the northern ice-spire at the lake's edge in the Whitshaws.

The strange spires on the landscape can be found north, south, and south-west of the cross-roads in the south-eastern Whitshaws.\n\nYou should scout the western-most ice-spire in the southern Whitshaws.
'Did you find anything noteworthy? Tell me everything -- but I have news for you as well.\n\n'Dunfast is empty!'
The strange spires on the landscape can be found north, south, and south-west of the cross-roads in the south-eastern Whitshaws.\n\nYou should scout the southern-most spire of ice in the Whitshaws.
Search the strange spire to the north
Find Cyneberg at Dunfast
Search the strange spire to the north

Strange Sights on the Horizon
